_header: That in thy mischief forsaked the nought
_description: ‘He is thi Frende’ — four monorhyming lines

CULAdd5943.Transcription:
þat in þy sorowe forsake þe notþat in þy
                    wele axe þe nouȝtþat in þy ttrespas forbere þe
                    noȝtþat in þy nede ne werie þe nouȝt
CULAdd5943.Facsimiles:
Mayer,  L. S. 
             Music, Cantilenas and Songs.
         London, 1906 (privately printed); by "L. S. M.". 
Rastall,  Richard. 
             “Introduction.” 
             A Fifteenth-Century Song Book: Cambridge University Library Additional
                MS 5943 made in facsimile.
         Leeds: Boethius Press, 1973.

BLCottCleoDVIII.Transcription:
Þat in þi myschief forsaken þe noȝthÞat in
                    þi bonchef askeþ þe noȝthÞat whan þu
                    trespassest for bereþ þe nothÞat in þi nede werniþ
                    þe noȝth
